page.title: 14PORTSDOWN HILL FORTS
page.content: On the hill above Portchester is Fort Nelson one of six forts on Portsdown Hill known as Palmerston's Follies. They were built in 1860 by Lord Palmerston who was Prime Minister to stop France invading Portsmouth but like most deterents they were never used. Now they are used as history museums. Fort Nelson is the only fort without an outer moat wall because the chalk sides are cut out vertically. The actual construction was completed by unemployed Dockyard Carpenters and Railway Navies. The main magazine was constructed under the parade ground with tunnels leading to below ground mortar batteries. The keep at the rear of the fort protects the gate. The line of forts is invisible from the north side where attack was expected.
